discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges Flask web application (Python 2.7.18, Werkzeug/1.0.1) - Port 5001, XSS challenge platform
http://localhost:5001/xss20 - XSS challenge endpoint returning 500 Internal Server Error - GET method only
http://localhost:5001/static/ - Static files directory (CSS, images, assets) - Directory listing disabled

targets.objective: Test for XSS vulnerabilities in challenge endpoints, outdated Python/Flask version exploitation (Python 2.7.18 EOL), debug mode information disclosure, session management flaws, missing security headers exploitation, and Flask/Werkzeug-specific vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: CTF/security challenge platform running on end-of-life Python 2.7.18 with Werkzeug 1.0.1. Missing security headers (no CSP, X-Frame-Options, HSTS). Referenced /xss25 endpoint not found suggests potential hidden endpoints. Core target for comprehensive web application testing.

targets.objective: Investigate 500 Internal Server Error for information disclosure, error-based vulnerabilities, debug mode exposure, parameter fuzzing to trigger different error conditions, and potential for error-based injection attacks
targets.rationale: Consistently returns 500 error regardless of parameters, suggesting application-level bug or misconfiguration. Error messages may leak sensitive information about application structure, file paths, or code. Only discovered non-404 endpoint besides homepage.

targets.objective: Test for directory traversal vulnerabilities, backup file exposure (.bak, .old, ~), source code disclosure (.py, .pyc files), configuration file access, and hidden sensitive files in static directory paths
targets.rationale: Static file server with inconsistent file availability (some referenced files 404). Directory listing disabled but individual file access works. Potential for discovering backup files, source code, or misplaced sensitive files in static paths.

keyFindings: [HIGH] End-of-life Python 2.7.18 in production - No longer receives security updates, multiple known vulnerabilities
[HIGH] Missing critical security headers - No X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy, X-XSS-Protection, HSTS, or X-Content-Type-Options headers present
[MEDIUM] XSS challenge endpoint /xss20 returns 500 Internal Server Error - Potential for information disclosure through error messages
[MEDIUM] Referenced endpoint /xss25 in homepage HTML returns 404 - Suggests potential hidden or misconfigured challenge endpoints
[LOW] Werkzeug/1.0.1 development server in use - May have debug mode enabled, not suitable for production
[LOW] Static file inconsistency - Some referenced files return 404 while others succeed (new_star.png vs logo5_white.png)
